reviews.review: Mind-bending, mind-blowing, mind-fucking. This movie was amazing!!!
A giant-size comicbook come to life. Hands down the best comicbook movie thus far.
Awesome climax. Comedy. Was bit too fast for me as if they try to squeeze everyone in. They could have made the movie longer

The Russo bros managed the impossible. Juggling a cast of over 20 characters, whilst delivering an astonishing and emotional story, worth the 10 year wait, and giving us the best villain yet in the MCU is extremely hard but this movie is proof that it is definitely possible.

A terrific "Beginning of the end" for the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The different heroes and worlds come together beautifully, the character chemistry works most of the time, and it manages to be comedic, without feeling light hearted, cheesy, or taking away from the brooding  atmosphere. Unlike any past MCU movies, this film was unafraid to take risks, and throw the unexpected at you, which truly made it great.

This movie was decent, and I would definitely go see it again. But the entire thing felt like one giant Third Act, with flimsy character development and little to no story. The plot drove the entire movie, which I personally don't like. The cinematography and sound were unremarkable, but that was to be expected; this is a Marvel movie.
That being said, I did like the special effects of the movie. They were pretty good. The character interactions were enjoyable as well, but did little to enhance character development. The story was lacking, if it was even there in the first place.
The end of the movie felt like Plot Point 2 or an "All is Lost / Dark Night of the Soul" moment rather than the ending. I was let down by the ending as a whole.
I really only felt genuine emotions for about five characters, which surprised me considering how many characters this movie threw together. There were a lot of in-between moments that could have been added to create a story, but those were either cut or never written in the first place. 
TL;DR: This movie was decent, but not the blockbuster hit I was expecting to see as the culmination of 10 years of moviemaking. Great action sequences but little substance. Subpar character development, but enjoyable interactions. Amazing score (shoutout to Alan Silvestri). I would give this movie a 7/10 if we had a 10 star scale, but RT only has 5.
An amazing culmination of 10 years of build up. Knocked off half a star due to Hawkeye and Ant-Man never showing up, which makes no sense.

This movie was extremely well made and handled the large cast very well. The only negative aspect of the film was that I found myself annoyed at the characters sometimes. Besides that, it was a fun, beautiful, and heart wrenching movie.

Y'all are crazy to give this a 93% there's no way possible to give all the heroes the best amount of screen time and yet this movie manages it. It makes you feel for thanos and what he loses.  Just an all around master piece
